item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Ani DiFranco
item.description: "Art is the reason I get up in the morning, but the definition ends there. It doesn't seem fair that I'm living for something I can't even define." -- Ani DiFranco

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by ani difranco
item.description: "I did not design this game; I did not name the stakes. I just happen to like apples; and I am not afraid of snakes." -- ani difranco

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Sam Levenson
item.description: "For Attractive lips, speak words of kindness. &emsp;For lovely eyes, seek out the good in people. &emsp;For a slim figure, share your food with the hungry. &emsp;For beautiful hair, let a child run their fingers through it once a day. &emsp;For poise, walk with the knowledge that you never walk alone. &emsp;People, more than things, have to be restored, renewed, revived, reclaimed, and redeemed. Remember, if you ever need a helping hand, you will find one at the end of each of your arms. &emsp;As you grow older, you will discover that you have two hands, one for helping yourself and the other for helping others." -- Sam Levenson

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!" -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Audrey Hepburn
item.description: "You can always tell what kind of a person a man really thinks you are by the earrings he gives you." -- Audrey Hepburn

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "May your heart always be joyful. May your song always be sung." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Don't criticize what you can't understand." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "I accept chaos, I'm not sure whether it accepts me." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "If you want to keep your memories, you first have to live them." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "Life is more or less a lie, but then again, that's exactly the way we want it to be." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Bob Dylan
item.description: "You don't need a weatherman to know which way the wind blows." -- Bob Dylan

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "We turn not older with years but newer every day." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "There is no Frigate like a Book To take us Lands away, Nor any Coursers like a Page Of prancing Poetry – This Traverse may the poorest take Without oppress of Toll – How frugal is the Chariot That bears a Human soul." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "It is better to live your own destiny imperfectly than to live an imitation of somebody else's life with perfection." -- Anonymous

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "Never forget that once upon a time, in an unguarded moment, you recognized yourself as a friend." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "As smoking is to the lungs, so is resentment to the soul; even one puff is bad for you." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Laurie Notaro
item.description: "There are things running around out there with uteruses,son. You're going to need this." -- Laurie Notaro

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Jim Henson
item.description: "The most sophisticated people I know - inside they are all children. " -- Jim Henson

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Cecelia Ahern
item.description: "She loved airports. She loved the smell, she loved the noise, and she loved the whole atmosphere as people walked around happily tugging their luggage, looking forward to going on their holidays or heading back home. She loved to see people arriving and being greeted with a big cheer by their families and she loved to watch them all giving each other emotional hugs. It was a perfect place for people-spotting. The airport always gave her a feeling of anticipation in the pit of her stomach as though she were about to do something special and amazing. Queuing at the boarding gate, she felt like she was waiting to go on a roller coaster ride at a theme park, like an excited little child." -- Cecelia Ahern

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "You don't love someone because they're perfect, you love them in spite of the fact that they're not." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "A photo says, you were happy, and I wanted to catch that. A photo says, you were so important to me that I put down everything else to come watch." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by A.A. Milne
item.description: "Weeds are flowers, too, once you get to know them." -- A.A. Milne

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Melissa Bank
item.description: "Time. There seems to be vast quantities of the stuff spooling around me in all directions, everywhere i look. Days and hours. Weeks and minutes. Years. The hard part, ive discovered, is filling it. " -- Melissa Bank

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Allen Saunders
item.description: "Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans." -- Allen Saunders

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by John Lennon
item.description: "You may say I'm a dreamer, but I'm not the only one. I hope someday you'll join us. And the world will live as one." -- John Lennon

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Marthe Troly-Curtin
item.description: "Time you enjoy wasting is not wasted time." -- Marthe Troly-Curtin

item.title: Potsie81 (Mary) add a quote by Chris Van Allsburg
item.description: "At one time, most of my friends could hear the bell, but as years passed, it fell silent for all of them. Even Sarah found one Christmas that she could no longer hear its sweet sound. Though I've grown old, the bell still rings for me, as it does for all who truly believe." -- Chris Van Allsburg
